annotations.message: The configuration of the instances of the Alertmanager cluster `{{$labels.service}}` are out of sync.

rules.name: AlertmanagerConfigInconsistent
rules.query: count_values by(service) ("config_hash", alertmanager_config_hash{job="prometheus-operator-alertmanager",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}) / on(service) group_left() label_replace(max by(name, job, namespace, controller) (prometheus_operator_spec_replicas{controller="alertmanager",job="prometheus-operator-operator",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}), "service", "$1", "name", "(.*)") != 1

annotations.message: Reloading Alertmanager's configuration has failed for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod}}.
Alertmanager has not found all other members of the cluster.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": insufficient members ({{ $value }}).
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": member {{ $labels.instance }} has no leader.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": instance {{ $labels.instance }} has seen {{ $value }} leader changes within the last hour.
etcd cluster "kube-etcd": 100% of requests for Watch failed on etcd instance 172.21.254.3:2381.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": {{ $value }}% of requests for {{ $labels.grpc_method }} failed on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.

rules.name: etcdHighNumberOfFailedGRPCRequests
rules.query: 100 * sum by(job, instance, grpc_service, grpc_method) (rate(grpc_server_handled_total{grpc_code!="OK",job=~".*etcd.*"}[5m])) / sum by(job, instance, grpc_service, grpc_method) (rate(grpc_server_handled_total{job=~".*etcd.*"}[5m])) > 1

annotations.message: etcd cluster "kube-etcd": 100% of requests for Watch failed on etcd instance 172.21.254.3:2381.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": {{ $value }}% of requests for {{ $labels.grpc_method }} failed on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.

rules.name: etcdHighNumberOfFailedGRPCRequests
rules.query: 100 * sum by(job, instance, grpc_service, grpc_method) (rate(grpc_server_handled_total{grpc_code!="OK",job=~".*etcd.*"}[5m])) / sum by(job, instance, grpc_service, grpc_method) (rate(grpc_server_handled_total{job=~".*etcd.*"}[5m])) > 5

annotations.message: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": gRPC requests to {{ $labels.grpc_method }} are taking {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.

rules.name: etcdGRPCRequestsSlow
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(job, instance, grpc_service, grpc_method, le) (rate(grpc_server_handling_seconds_bucket{grpc_type="unary",job=~".*etcd.*"}[5m]))) > 0.15

annotations.message: etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": member communication with {{ $labels.To }} is taking {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": {{ $value }} proposal failures within the last hour on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": 99th percentile fync durations are {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
etcd cluster "{{ $labels.job }}": 99th percentile commit durations {{ $value }}s on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
{{ $value }}% of requests for {{ $labels.method }} failed on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}
{{ $value }}% of requests for {{ $labels.method }} failed on etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }}.
etcd instance {{ $labels.instance }} HTTP requests to {{ $labels.method }} are slow.
{{ printf "%.4g" $value }}% of the {{ $labels.job }}/{{ $labels.service }} targets in {{ $labels.namespace }} namespace are down.

rules.name: TargetDown
rules.query: 100 * (count by(job, namespace, service) (up == 0) / count by(job, namespace, service) (up)) > 10

annotations.message:
This is an alert meant to ensure that the entire alerting pipeline is functional.
This alert is always firing, therefore it should always be firing in Alertmanager
and always fire against a receiver. There are integrations with various notification
mechanisms that send a notification when this alert is not firing. For example the
"DeadMansSnitch" integration in PagerDuty.

This is an alert meant to ensure that the entire alerting pipeline is functional.
This alert is always firing, therefore it should always be firing in Alertmanager
and always fire against a receiver. There are integrations with various notification
mechanisms that send a notification when this alert is not firing. For example the
"DeadMansSnitch" integration in PagerDuty.

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_rate
rules.query: sum by(cluster, namespace, pod, container) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{container!="POD",image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"}[5m])) * on(cluster, namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(cluster, namespace, pod) (1, max by(cluster, namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_working_set_bytes
rules.query: container_memory_working_set_bytes{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_rss
rules.query: container_memory_rss{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_cache
rules.query: container_memory_cache{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info))

rules.name: node_namespace_pod_container:container_memory_swap
rules.query: container_memory_swap{image!="",job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics/cadvisor"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(namespace, pod, node) (kube_pod_info))

rules.name: namespace:kube_pod_container_resource_requests_memory_bytes:sum
rules.query: sum by(namespace) (sum by(namespace, pod) (max by(namespace, pod, container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests_memory_bytes{job="kube-state-metrics"}) * on(namespace, pod) group_left() max by(namespace, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: namespace:kube_pod_container_resource_requests_cpu_cores:sum
rules.query: sum by(namespace) (sum by(namespace, pod) (max by(namespace, pod, container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests_cpu_cores{job="kube-state-metrics"}) * on(namespace, pod) group_left() max by(namespace, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{phase=~"Pending|Running"} == 1)))

rules.name: mixin_pod_workload
rules.query: max by(cluster, namespace, workload, pod) (label_replace(label_replace(kube_pod_owner{job="kube-state-metrics",owner_kind="ReplicaSet"}, "replicaset", "$1", "owner_name", "(.*)") * on(replicaset, namespace) group_left(owner_name) topk by(replicaset, namespace) (1, max by(replicaset, namespace, owner_name) (kube_replicaset_owner{job="kube-state-metrics"})), "workload", "$1", "owner_name", "(.*)"))

annotations.message: The API server is burning too much error budget
The API server is burning too much error budget
The API server is burning too much error budget
The API server is burning too much error budget

rules.name: cluster:apiserver_request_duration_seconds:mean5m
rules.query: sum without(instance, pod) (rate(apiserver_request_duration_seconds_sum{subresource!="log",verb!~"LIST|WATCH|WATCHLIST|DELETECOLLECTION|PROXY|CONNECT"}[5m])) / sum without(instance, pod) (rate(apiserver_request_duration_seconds_count{subresource!="log",verb!~"LIST|WATCH|WATCHLIST|DELETECOLLECTION|PROXY|CONNECT"}[5m]))

rules.name: instance:node_cpu:ratio
rules.query: sum without(cpu, mode) (rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[5m])) / on(instance) group_left() count by(instance) (sum by(instance, cpu) (node_cpu_seconds_total))

annotations.message: kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors at an elevated rate in list operations. This is likely causing it to not be able to expose metrics about Kubernetes objects correctly or at all.
kube-state-metrics is experiencing errors at an elevated rate in watch operations. This is likely causing it to not be able to expose metrics about Kubernetes objects correctly or at all.

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.9, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

rules.name: node_quantile:kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.5, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pleg_relist_duration_seconds_bucket[5m])) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"})

annotations.message: Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} ({{ $labels.container }}) is restarting {{ printf "%.2f" $value }} times / 5 minutes.
Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} has been in a non-ready state for longer than 15 minutes.

rules.name: KubePodNotReady
rules.query: sum by(namespace, pod) (max by(namespace, pod) (kube_pod_status_phase{job="kube-state-metrics",namespace=~".*",phase=~"Pending|Unknown"}) * on(namespace, pod) group_left(owner_kind) max by(namespace, pod, owner_kind) (kube_pod_owner{owner_kind!="Job"})) > 0

annotations.message: Deployment generation for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} does not match, this indicates that the Deployment has failed but has not been rolled back.
Deployment {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.deployment }} has not matched the expected number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
StatefulSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} has not matched the expected number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
StatefulSet generation for {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} does not match, this indicates that the StatefulSet has failed but has not been rolled back.
StatefulSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.statefulset }} update has not been rolled out.
Only {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of the desired Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are scheduled and ready.
Pod {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }} container {{ $labels.container}} has been in waiting state for longer than 1 hour.
{{ $value }} Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are not scheduled.
{{ $value }} Pods of DaemonSet {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.daemonset }} are running where they are not supposed to run.
CronJob {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.cronjob }} is taking more than 1h to complete.
Job {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.job_name }} is taking more than one hour to complete.
Job {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.job_name }} failed to complete.
HPA {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.hpa }} has not matched the desired number of replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
HPA {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.hpa }} has been running at max replicas for longer than 15 minutes.
Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Pods and cannot tolerate node failure.
Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Pods and cannot tolerate node failure.
Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests for Pods and cannot tolerate node failure.
Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests for Pods and cannot tolerate node failure.
Cluster has overcommitted CPU resource requests for Namespaces.
Cluster has overcommitted memory resource requests for Namespaces.
Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is using {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its {{ $labels.resource }} quota.
{{ $value | humanizePercentage }} throttling of CPU in namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} for container {{ $labels.container }} in pod {{ $labels.pod }}.

rules.name: CPUThrottlingHigh
rules.query: sum by(container, pod, namespace) (increase(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total{container!=""}[5m])) / sum by(container, pod, namespace) (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total[5m])) > (25 / 100)

annotations.message: The PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is only {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} free.

Based on recent sampling, the PersistentVolume claimed by {{ $labels.persistentvolumeclaim }} in Namespace {{ $labels.namespace }} is expected to fill up within four days. Currently {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} is available.
The persistent volume {{ $labels.persistentvolume }} has status {{ $labels.phase }}.
The API server has an abnormal latency of {{ $value }} seconds for {{ $labels.verb }} {{ $labels.resource }}.

rules.name: KubeAPILatencyHigh
rules.query: (cluster:apiserver_request_duration_seconds:mean5m{job="apiserver"} > on(verb) group_left() (avg by(verb) (cluster:apiserver_request_duration_seconds:mean5m{job="apiserver"} >= 0) + 2 * stddev by(verb) (cluster:apiserver_request_duration_seconds:mean5m{job="apiserver"} >= 0))) > on(verb) group_left() 1.2 * avg by(verb) (cluster:apiserver_request_duration_seconds:mean5m{job="apiserver"} >= 0) and on(verb, resource) cluster_quantile:apiserver_request_duration_seconds:histogram_quantile{job="apiserver",quantile="0.99"} > 1

annotations.message: API server is returning errors for {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of requests for {{ $labels.verb }} {{ $labels.resource }} {{ $labels.subresource }}.

rules.name: KubeAPIErrorsHigh
rules.query: sum by(resource, subresource, verb) (rate(apiserver_request_total{code=~"5..",job="apiserver"}[5m])) / sum by(resource, subresource, verb) (rate(apiserver_request_total{job="apiserver"}[5m])) > 0.05

annotations.message: A client certificate used to authenticate to the apiserver is expiring in less than 7.0 days.

rules.name: KubeClientCertificateExpiration
rules.query: apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_count{job="apiserver"} > 0 and on(job) histogram_quantile(0.01, sum by(job, le) (rate(apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_bucket{job="apiserver"}[5m]))) < 604800

annotations.message: A client certificate used to authenticate to the apiserver is expiring in less than 24.0 hours.

rules.name: KubeClientCertificateExpiration
rules.query: apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_count{job="apiserver"} > 0 and on(job) histogram_quantile(0.01, sum by(job, le) (rate(apiserver_client_certificate_expiration_seconds_bucket{job="apiserver"}[5m]))) < 86400

annotations.message: An aggregated API {{ $labels.name }}/{{ $labels.namespace }} has reported errors. The number of errors have increased for it in the past five minutes. High values indicate that the availability of the service changes too often.
An aggregated API {{ $labels.name }}/{{ $labels.namespace }} is down. It has not been available at least for the past five minutes.
KubeAPI has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
KubeControllerManager has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
{{ $labels.node }} has been unready for more than 15 minutes.
{{ $labels.node }} is unreachable and some workloads may be rescheduled.
Kubelet '{{ $labels.node }}' is running at {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of its Pod capacity.

rules.name: KubeletTooManyPods
rules.query: max by(node) (max by(instance) (kubelet_running_pod_count{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}) / max by(node) (kube_node_status_capacity_pods{job="kube-state-metrics"} != 1) > 0.95

annotations.message: The readiness status of node {{ $labels.node }} has changed {{ $value }} times in the last 15 minutes.
The Kubelet Pod Lifecycle Event Generator has a 99th percentile duration of {{ $value }} seconds on node {{ $labels.node }}.
Kubelet Pod startup 99th percentile latency is {{ $value }} seconds on node {{ $labels.node }}.

rules.name: KubeletPodStartUpLatencyHigh
rules.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(instance, le) (rate(kubelet_pod_worker_duration_seconds_bucket{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"}[5m]))) * on(instance) group_left(node) kubelet_node_name{job="kubelet",metrics_path="/metrics"} > 60

annotations.message: Kubelet has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
KubeScheduler has disappeared from Prometheus target discovery.
There are {{ $value }} different semantic versions of Kubernetes components running.
Kubernetes API server client '{{ $labels.job }}/{{ $labels.instance }}' is experiencing {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} errors.'

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left and is filling up.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of space within the next 24 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left and is filling up fast.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of space within the next 4 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available space left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 3% space left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left and is filling up.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of inodes within the next 24 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left and is filling up fast.
annotations.summary: Filesystem is predicted to run out of inodes within the next 4 hours.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 5% inodes left.

annotations.description: Filesystem on {{ $labels.device }} at {{ $labels.instance }} has only {{ printf "%.2f" $value }}% available inodes left.
annotations.summary: Filesystem has less than 3% inodes left.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} receive errors in the last two minutes.
annotations.summary: Network interface is reporting many receive errors.

annotations.description: {{ $labels.instance }} interface {{ $labels.device }} has encountered {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} transmit errors in the last two minutes.
annotations.summary: Network interface is reporting many transmit errors.

annotations.description: {{ $value | humanizePercentage }} of conntrack entries are used
annotations.summary: Number of conntrack are getting close to the limit

annotations.message: Clock on {{ $labels.instance }} is out of sync by more than 300s. Ensure NTP is configured correctly on this host.
annotations.summary: Clock skew detected.

annotations.message: Clock on {{ $labels.instance }} is not synchronising. Ensure NTP is configured on this host.
annotations.summary: Clock not synchronising.

annotations.message: Network interface "{{ $labels.device }}" changing it's up status often on node-exporter {{ $labels.namespace }}/{{ $labels.pod }}"

rules.name: node_namespace_pod:kube_pod_info:
rules.query: topk by(namespace, pod) (1, max by(node, namespace, pod) (label_replace(kube_pod_info{job="kube-state-metrics"}, "pod", "$1", "pod", "(.*)")))

rules.name: node:node_num_cpu:sum
rules.query: count by(cluster, node) (sum by(node, cpu) (node_cpu_seconds_total{job="node-exporter"} * on(namespace, pod) group_left(node) node_namespace_pod:kube_pod_info:))

annotations.message: Errors while reconciling {{ $labels.controller }} in {{ $labels.namespace }} Namespace.
Errors while reconciling Prometheus in {{ $labels.namespace }} Namespace.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has failed to reload its configuration.
annotations.summary: Failed Prometheus configuration reload.

annotations.description: Alert notification queue of Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is running full.
annotations.summary: Prometheus alert notification queue predicted to run full in less than 30m.

annotations.description: {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}% errors while sending alerts from Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} to Alertmanager {{$labels.alertmanager}}.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has encountered more than 1% errors sending alerts to a specific Alertmanager.

annotations.description: {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}% minimum errors while sending alerts from Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} to any Alertmanager.
annotations.summary: Prometheus encounters more than 3% errors sending alerts to any Alertmanager.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is not connected to any Alertmanagers.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is not connected to any Alertmanagers.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has detected {{$value | humanize}} reload failures over the last 3h.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has issues reloading blocks from disk.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has detected {{$value | humanize}} compaction failures over the last 3h.
annotations.summary: Prometheus has issues compacting blocks.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is not ingesting samples.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is not ingesting samples.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is dropping {{ printf "%.4g" $value  }} samples/s with different values but duplicated timestamp.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is dropping samples with duplicate timestamps.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} is dropping {{ printf "%.4g" $value  }} samples/s with timestamps arriving out of order.
annotations.summary: Prometheus drops samples with out-of-order timestamps.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} failed to send {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}% of the samples to {{ $labels.remote_name}}:{{ $labels.url }}
annotations.summary: Prometheus fails to send samples to remote storage.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} remote write is {{ printf "%.1f" $value }}s behind for {{ $labels.remote_name}}:{{ $labels.url }}.
annotations.summary: Prometheus remote write is behind.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} remote write desired shards calculation wants to run {{ $value }} shards for queue {{ $labels.remote_name}}:{{ $labels.url }}, which is more than the max of {{ printf `prometheus_remote_storage_shards_max{instance="%s",job="prometheus-operator-prometheus",namespace="metalk8s-monitoring"}` $labels.instance | query | first | value }}.
annotations.summary: Prometheus remote write desired shards calculation wants to run more than configured max shards.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has failed to evaluate {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} rules in the last 5m.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is failing rule evaluations.

annotations.description: Prometheus {{$labels.namespace}}/{{$labels.pod}} has missed {{ printf "%.0f" $value }} rule group evaluations in the last 5m.
annotations.summary: Prometheus is missing rule evaluations due to slow rule group evaluation.
